title: 'We couldn't have asked for a smarter deal' - Telegraph readers on this week's top stories
text:
Boris Johnson unveiled his Brexit proposal this week. The Telegraph obtained the first details of the proposal on the Irish backstop and provided a section by section breakdown. Telegraph readers' reactions to the proposal were mixed.

They did, however, agree that Dina Asher-Smith’s historic win at the Athletics World Championships was deserving of the highest praise.

Elsewhere, Tom Welsh argued that giving 16 and 17-year-olds the vote would be a highly cynical act of gerrymandering. Telegraph readers were divided over whether it would be wise to extend the franchise to include 16 and 17-year-olds.

And readers were as befuddled as William Sitwell over tipping etiquette. Many suggested that...
description: Boris Johnson unveiled his Brexit proposal this week.
